```{r echo = FALSE}
library(plotly)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
bottle_rda <- here("data/processed/bottle.RData")
load(bottle_rda)
```

```{r}
bottle
```


```{r echo=FALSE}
#Get the average oxygen for a given time period
start <- as.Date("07-02-2000", "%m-%d-%Y")
end <- as.Date("07-02-2010", "%m-%d-%Y")
lineID <- 093.3
stationID <- 080.0
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
#Find all oxygen value in the date range at a specific line, station
bottle %>%
    subset(start < date & end > date) %>%
    group_by(station, line)  %>%
    select(oxygen)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
